Subject: Wills & Succession
Question: When can a person make an oral will?
Answer: An oral will may be made by a person who is under extraordinary circumstances threatening his life that do not make it possible to make a written will.

Subject: Wills & Succession
Question: What are the rules for a private written will?
Answer: A private written will may either be written by the testator himself or the testator may have another person write it. A type-written will shall not qualify as one written in own hand.

Subject: Wills & Succession
Question: When is a spouse excluded from inheritance?
Answer: The spouse of the estate leaver may not inherit if the spouses did not live together in community of life upon the opening of succession and it is evident there was no prospect of restoring it.

Subject: Contracts
Question: How can parties settle a disputed matter?
Answer: The parties may also settle their disputed or uncertain matters arising from an obligation by mutual concession, or if one of the parties unilaterally concedes some of his claim.

Subject: Obligations
Question: What are the rules regarding the name of a legal person?
Answer: The name of the legal person shall differ from that of other previously registered legal persons to such an extent that they cannot be confused.
